thread.title: West Ham 0-5 Manchester City player ratings: Which Hammers score a THREE after FA Cup humiliation?
thread.title_full: West Ham 0-5 Manchester City player ratings: Which Hammers score a THREE after FA Cup humiliation?

author: Darren Lewis
title: West Ham 0-5 Manchester City player ratings: Which Hammers score a THREE after FA Cup humiliation?
text:
West Ham players react as City celebrate (Photo: Ian Walton)   
West Ham's first FA Cup game at the London Stadium ended in a humiliating defeat to Manchester City. 
City opened the scoring in controversial circumstances as Yaya Toure beat Adrian after Pablo Zabaleta had been felled. 
Havard Nordveit turned into his own net before David Silva made it three before the break. 
West Ham failed to improve after half-time as Sergio Aguero flicked in a fourth for Pep Guardiola's men. David Silva scores City's third goal (Photo: Toby Melville/Reuters) Manchester city players celebrate (Photo: Nigel French/PA) 
John Stones made it five with his first goal for City late on with a fine header. 
Our man Darren Lewis was at the London Stadium - and he was not impressed with Slaven Bilic's hapless Hammers. West Ham 
Adrian 3 - No chance with spot-kick king Toure and an own goal to start the rout. 
Nordtveit 3 - Some good, decisive tackling before the penalty. Unlucky with the OG. Awol after that. Havard Nordtveit scores an own goal (Photo: Toby Melville/Reuters) 
Reid 4 - Like Nordveit some good, decisive blocks early on but gave up after the first two. 
Ogbonna 3 - Unlucky to concede the soft spot-kick that started the house crashing down. 
Cresswell 3 - Bypassed on way too many occasions by Silva, Sagna and Sterling. 
Fernandes 3 - Unable to stop City, who grew in confidence, dominating out wide. Edimilson Fernandes in action (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) 
Obiang 3 - City had far too much craft and creativity for him in midfield 
Feghouli 3 - Missed a sitter at 1-0 that could have changed the course of the game. 
Lanzini 4 - Not at his best but, to be fair, a difficult night for the whole team. 
Antonio 4 - Forced Cabellero into a save in the first half but unable to hurt City after. Antonio tries his luck (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Carroll 4 - Needed some decent delivery into the box. Didn’t get it. 
Subs 
Noble 4 (for Lanzini, 58), 
Payet 4 (for Carroll, 58), 
Fletcher 4 (for Antonio, 72) Yaya Toure puts City ahead (Photo: Catherine Ivill - AMA/Getty) John Stones scores City's fifth goal (Photo: John Sibley/Reuters) Manchester City 
Caballero 7 - Uncertain footwork early on but saved well from Antonio and easy after the goals. 
Sagna 8 - More than comfortable for the former Arsenal right-back who coasted through this one. 
Stones 8 - He’ll have enjoyed this confidence booster with West Ham lacking the firepower to make an impact. 
Otamendi 7 - City’s success in stopping the supply for Carroll meant a comfortable night for him Otamendi challenges Ashley Fletcher (Photo: Dan Mullan) 
Clichy 7 - Set up Silva for an early chance. Lots of authority in defence. 
Zabaleta 8 - A rare start in midfield and did well, even enjoyed an effort on goal. 
Toure 8 - Brilliant from the spot as usual. In charge in midfield alongside Zabaleta. 
Sterling 9 MOTM - Made a goal, forced an own goal and ran rings around the Hammers. Sterling's shot is blocked by Winston Reid (Photo: Dan Mullan) 
Silva 8 - Classy. Sat Adrian on his backside before scoring at his leisure. 
De Bruyne 7 - Not at his dominant best but still too good for this West Ham side. 
Aguero 7 - Back in the saddle with his second half goal. Get him back in your fantasy team. 
Subs 
Nolito 7 (for Silva 58), 
Garcia 6 (for De Bruyne 68), 
Delph 5 (for Toure 75) poll loading Will Manchester City win the FA Cup? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
